structure.unit: B LICENSURE AND REGULATION OF HEALTH FACILITIES AND SERVICES

law.catch_line: Course on recognition and prevention of pediatric abusive head trauma to be given by urgent treatment facility and urgent care facility.

text.section: As used in this section, "urgent treatment facility" or "urgent care facility" means a facility that delivers medically necessary ambulatory medical care apart from a hospital emergency department setting usually on a walk-in basis.

All urgent treatment or urgent care facilities shall make available at least one (1) time every two (2) years a continuing education course relating to the recognition and prevention of pediatric abusive head trauma, as defined in KRS 620.020. Training in recognizing pediatric abusive head trauma may be designed in collaboration with organizations and agencies that specialize in the prevention and recognition of pediatric abusive head trauma approved by the secretary of the Cabinet for Health and Family Services.

law.history: Created 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 171, sec. 10, effective July 15, 2010.
